intro: Selinum paniculatum, commonly known as upright parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of parsley, and it produces small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in compound umbels. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in moist, calcareous soils. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine. Selinum paniculatum is typically perennial and can grow up to 1 meter in height.
